channel.title: Getting Started on Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Workshop

item.title: Connect to Event Engine
item.description: The following steps should be executed to connect to EventEngine. 1. Open you browser and navigate to the following URL: https://dashboard.eventengine.run 2. Insert the hash token provided by the AWS employee 3. The output screen contains all the credentials and information that you will need to execute this lab. Bellow is a sample screenshot üìù Note: Clicking on the file icon will copy the information to the clipboard. 4.

item.title: Create a Workspace
item.description: A list of supported browsers for AWS Cloud9 is found here. Ad blockers, javascript disablers, and tracking blockers should be disabled for the cloud9 domain, or connecting to the workspace might be impacted. Cloud9 requires third-party-cookies. You can whitelist the specific domains. Launch Cloud9 in the region selected previously Navigate to the Cloud9 console. Select Create environment Name it MovingUpTheStackWorkshop, click Next step. Since we only need to access our Cloud9 environment via web browser, please select the Create a new no-ingress EC2 instance for environment (access via Systems Manager) under the Environment Type.

item.title: Configure your Workspace
item.description: Follow this deep link to create an IAM role with Administrator access. Confirm that AWS service and EC2 are selected, then click Next: Permissions to view permissions. Confirm that AdministratorAccess is checked, then click Next: Tags to assign tags. Take the defaults, and click Next: Review to review. Enter movingupworkshop-admin for the Name, and click Create role. Click the grey circle button (in top right corner) and select Manage EC2 Instance.
